items.sentence: I should\'ve tried harder to get the report finished on time.
Tom is always studying, but he never seems to learn anything.
Tom is convinced that Mary is the one who stole his clarinet.
Tom thought that Mary was probably still somewhere in Boston.
Tom told us that we would eat as soon as we got to the cabin.
Tom tried to stop Mary from drinking the last bottle of wine.
I should\'ve known Tom wouldn\'t do what we wanted him to do.
I smelled Mary\'s perfume, so I knew she\'d been in the room.
Tom was unlucky to be in the bank when the holdup took place.
I heard your voices and wondered what you were talking about.
I just remembered that I was supposed to buy a loaf of bread.
Tom expected at least a ten percent return on his investment.
Tom has already spent all the money that his father left him.
Tom was highly educated and spoke several languages fluently.
Tom wrote his phone number on a napkin and handed it to Mary.
Let\'s not forget that Tom doesn\'t know how to speak French.
I don\'t have any money and I don\'t have any friends either.
Who did Tom think would want to stay for another three hours?
Would you have liked the dress if it had been a darker color?
Just by looking at your face, I know that you have good news.
